[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-05 08:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-09 04:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-03-09 09:55:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Do we really really need to do this? It's bloating the ref sources and the ref pages, alot. Thinking who the consumers of the API ref is, I do not see why would we need to hold their hands and explain each individual HTTP response code on each individual API component again and again.

Technically I don't see any problems, the pages does seem to render just fine. It's just a lot of extra content there and I'm not sure at all about the value for such."}, {'account_id': 26734, 'date': '2018-03-09 19:08:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think if the work is done we should approve it. The layout looks better for sure. I do agree that I'm not sure we need to expand on the error codes in the future."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-13 21:18:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-13 21:21:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Fixed an issue with the title levels for the codes that was causing the show/hide functionality to not work.

The only reason to add this is for consistency with others and having clear and commonly defined descriptions for the codes. I wanted to update it so you could take a look at better results, but Glance can certainly choose not to use this part of os-api-ref for our api docs. If you take a look and still do not like how this changes things, just let me know and I can abandon this patch.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-24 20:38:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Use rest_status_code for api-ref response codes

The os-api-ref sphinx extension we use has a rest_status_code
directive for being able to list the possible response codes
in a consistent format with commonly defined descriptions. This
switches over from using the textual way to this common way.

Change-Id: I0f01a887abfa2f49269d4a3bc2d431d283a7832f

commit_message:
Remove usage of deprecated RamFilter

As of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596502/ the RamFilter
in nova is deprecated and not necessary when using the
default scheduler driver (filter_scheduler).

Change-Id: If2a6f6d17cc9eef0d17a2fe2886d28e0c4d83849

From what I understand from the bug report, the reason that the allocation for DISK_GB is against the compute node and not the sharing provider is because the compute node resource provider is (mistakenly) getting an inventory record of DISK_GB created.

commit_message:
Normalize inventory from update_provider_tree

We thought we didn't have to normalize inventory (set allocation ratios
and reserved amounts from the compute node record) when taking the
update_provider_tree path in the resource tracker [1] because we wanted
the virt driver to be the source of truth for those values.

We still do want that, and that's still the case (because we only set
them if unset). But since the virt driver doesn't have access to the
compute_node object itself, until and unless we stop setting those
values on the compute_node, we still have to do that normalization even
for the update_provider_tree path. This patch makes it so.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/4b4e005c639204f2c680eda61131a6930379d70e/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L884-L886

Change-Id: I6a706ec5966cdc85f97223617662fe15d3e6dc08

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 18:33:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix corner case in failure assigning MAC to SR-IOV NIC

Sometimes due to NIC driver incorrect behavior, VFs might be
missing in 'ip link show' output.  This may lead to a VM boot
failure as agent will just skip such missing devices.

Make the agent do a resync in case a newly added device
'disappears' during processing, which should cause a MAC to
get assigned.

Co-authored-by: Oleg Bondarev <obondarev@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I148b5a025fc388821fd1269d02908cc8ce1882fe
Closes-bug: #1784484
(cherry picked from commit eea5aaac4f5c62ed0c74bd7e922680e20b87bb6b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix corner case in failure assigning MAC to SR-IOV NIC

Sometimes due to NIC driver incorrect behavior, VFs might be
missing in 'ip link show' output.  This may lead to a VM boot
failure as agent will just skip such missing devices.

Make the agent do a resync in case a newly added device
'disappears' during processing, which should cause a MAC to
get assigned.

Co-authored-by: Oleg Bondarev <obondarev@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I148b5a025fc388821fd1269d02908cc8ce1882fe
Closes-bug: #1784484
(cherry picked from commit eea5aaac4f5c62ed0c74bd7e922680e20b87bb6b)

commit_message:
Move ovsdbapp jobs to its tree

This patch is moving the legacy CI jobs for ovsdbapp into its tree. This
will give the project more flexibility to control what jobs should run
in which pipeline as well as facilitate creation/deletion/updates for
new and existing jobs.

Change-Id: I2e34bd16ab9907bdc3f9225b879f9b0846d2c779
(cherry picked from commit 969a201ee45d60d1682679496dd0a967a251c14e)

commit_message:
WIP: Be more conservative with Postgres liveness

In some environments, the liveness probe triggers to kill the pod during
its initial startup.  This leaves postgres in a permanently unhealthy
state, because the `postgres` database has not correctly.

Depends-On: I2f2012590d81ffcb159d49d8a76eedd4441744cd
Change-Id: I799cccc995b869ae333cf6b6849ec60fca8e3d18

node blocks on settings
settings blocks on the fact we have no nodes which are ready because they have no cni
<deadlock>

this doesn't come up in other envs because in testing the node read/notready status doesn't update quickly when we futz the cni quickly

so we can't block node ... it installs the cni ... we have to look at splitting that out

simpler would be to make sure when settings runs is (reconfigures) things correctly"}, {'account_id': 25907, 'date': '2018-10-24 19:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-07 18:35:40.000000000', 'message': "Add calico-node dependency on calico-settings job

This avoids a race discovered in some Airship deployments where if the
first calico-node pod comes up before the calico-settings job finishes,
the calico-node pod doesn't correctly detect and update for bgpPeers
added to calico's etcd by the settings job (which should happen via
confd).

Upgrading the chart to modify the bgpPeers later seems to work
correctly, so the root cause of this race is unclear and this dependency
avoids the race on initial start.

Change-Id: Ib87d658d93c87f7faad85564767faa62d71f1994

commit_message:
Add calico-node dependency on calico-settings job

This avoids a race discovered in some Airship deployments where if the
first calico-node pod comes up before the calico-settings job finishes,
the calico-node pod doesn't correctly detect and update for bgpPeers
added to calico's etcd by the settings job (which should happen via
confd).

Upgrading the chart to modify the bgpPeers later seems to work
correctly, so the root cause of this race is unclear and this dependency
avoids the race on initial start.

Change-Id: Ib87d658d93c87f7faad85564767faa62d71f1994

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 14:25:29.000000000', 'message': "Ensure attachment cleanup on failure in driver.pre_live_migration

Previously, if the call to driver.pre_live_migration failed (which in
libvirt can happen with a DestinationDiskExists exception), the
compute manager wouldn't rollback/cleanup volume attachments, leading
to corrupt volume attachment information, and, depending on the
backend, the instance being unable to access its volume. This patch
moves the driver.pre_live_migration call inside the existing
try/except, allowing the compute manager to properly rollback/cleanup
volume attachments.

The compute manager has its own _rollback_live_migration() cleanup in
case the pre_live_migration() RPC call to the destination fails. There
should be no conflicts between the cleanup in that and the new volume
cleanup in the except block. The remove_volume_connection() ->
driver_detach() -> detach_volume() call catches the InstanceNotFound
exception and warns about the instance disappearing (it was never
really on the destination in the first place). The attachment_delete()
in _rollback_live_migration() is contingent on there being an
old_vol_attachment in migrate_data, which there isn't because
pre_live_migration() raised instead of returning.

Change-Id: I67f66e95d69ae6df22e539550a3eac697ea8f5d8
Closes-bug: 1778206
(cherry picked from commit 1a29248d5e688ba1d4f806895dccd45fcb34b833)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure attachment cleanup on failure in driver.pre_live_migration

Previously, if the call to driver.pre_live_migration failed (which in
libvirt can happen with a DestinationDiskExists exception), the
compute manager wouldn't rollback/cleanup volume attachments, leading
to corrupt volume attachment information, and, depending on the
backend, the instance being unable to access its volume. This patch
moves the driver.pre_live_migration call inside the existing
try/except, allowing the compute manager to properly rollback/cleanup
volume attachments.

The compute manager has its own _rollback_live_migration() cleanup in
case the pre_live_migration() RPC call to the destination fails. There
should be no conflicts between the cleanup in that and the new volume
cleanup in the except block. The remove_volume_connection() ->
driver_detach() -> detach_volume() call catches the InstanceNotFound
exception and warns about the instance disappearing (it was never
really on the destination in the first place). The attachment_delete()
in _rollback_live_migration() is contingent on there being an
old_vol_attachment in migrate_data, which there isn't because
pre_live_migration() raised instead of returning.

Change-Id: I67f66e95d69ae6df22e539550a3eac697ea8f5d8
Closes-bug: 1778206
(cherry picked from commit 1a29248d5e688ba1d4f806895dccd45fcb34b833)

commit_message:
Move live_migration.pre.start to the start of the method

This simply moves the pre_live_migration start notification
back to the start of the method before creating new volume
attachments. While in here, the list of bdms are passed to
the notify_about_instance_action method so if
[notifications]/bdms_in_notifications is True we don't have
to pull them out of the database again for each versioned
notification.

Change-Id: I372eddb9e356b02328f937917a856bc631691f53
Partial-Bug: #1763051
(cherry picked from commit 7a2228142b8f8f015a554e2b25198ab37811a058)

commit_message:
Remove kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-lbaasv2 job

This commit removes kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-lbaasv2 job from the gate,
as with deprecation of deployments without kuryr-daemon it becomes
obsolete and redundant to similar Octavia job.

Change-Id: Ib8794c3f4d104fe699e80999019cd644300489ca

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-25 09:28:31.000000000', 'message': "swift: container ACL - use ID's for tenant and user

Switch to using ID's instead of names for the test tenant and user.

Under Keystone v3 names (vs ids) are only supported for members of
the 'default' domain, so if accounts are created in a different domain
the container ACL tests will fail.

Switch to using ID's which are guaranteed to be unique across domains,
resolving test failures in this type of deployment configuration.

Change-Id: I79e5754379e3cf72d2a9858e6e69e8c190b0b2ed
"}]
commit_message:
swift: container ACL - use ID's for tenant and user

Switch to using ID's instead of names for the test tenant and user.

Under Keystone v3 names (vs ids) are only supported for members of
the 'default' domain, so if accounts are created in a different domain
the container ACL tests will fail.

Switch to using ID's which are guaranteed to be unique across domains,
resolving test failures in this type of deployment configuration.

Change-Id: I79e5754379e3cf72d2a9858e6e69e8c190b0b2ed

commit_message:
Release python-senlinclient 1.9.0

This is the Stein milestone-1 release for python-senlinclient to
release merged commits since the last release.

See [1] for more details on the new cycle-with-intermediary library
release changes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135689.html

We plan on processing this release November 1 unless we are told to hold
off, or earlier if we get a +1 from the PTL and/or release liaison
indicating that it is all clear to proceed.

Change-Id: I53d284d4b234bd638e4f5f930c12662ecac7ac13
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

after deletion.

(cherry picked from commit 906a1d3f689b9226cb949153fc9b07d287e7ff75)

commit_message:
Invalidate app cred AFTER deletion

Invalidate the application credential after deletion, not before.
This prevents timing issues where an app_cred could remain active
after deletion.

Change-Id: I14748bf2399e5da4ee360f451a8050f25dd90803
(cherry picked from commit 906a1d3f689b9226cb949153fc9b07d287e7ff75)

Change assert_ with optimal assertTrue

assert_() is deprecated in Python 3.x, use assertTrue() instead.[1]

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#

commit_message:
Use tempest instead of Tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been deprecated since a year. All
the interfaces available in tempest-lib are now available
in tempest/lib.

This patch make use of tempest/lib instead of tempest-lib.
Also add tempest in test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I43daeeb279aeb137ace495578cd49ea933338515

commit_message:
Removing the setting of the nova policy line

Due to the removal of the nova policy.json file, everthing is
failing the dsvm gate. This should fix the until devstack addresses
the recent nova change.
Also fix pep8 failures

Change-Id: I69681dbb9cc9dcbe02e2e5514d999747b7efeae3
Fixes-Bug: 1642713

Change order of import in code

Alphabetically order your imports by the full module path.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I318fc77bdbcc5e3e0ce158d022568a772b9c084c

[{'created': '2017-07-13 10:48:08.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused None from dict.get()

Since the default value is None when can't get a key from a dict,
So there is no need to use dict.get('key', None).

Change-Id: Ida6019a8efd66099635e250bbabf43f728378695
"}, {'created': '2017-07-13 11:33:02.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused None from dict.get()

Since the default value is None when can't get a key from a dict,
So there is no need to use dict.get('key', None).

Change-Id: Ida6019a8efd66099635e250bbabf43f728378695
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused None from dict.get()

Since the default value is None when can't get a key from a dict,
So there is no need to use dict.get('key', None).

Change-Id: Ida6019a8efd66099635e250bbabf43f728378695

commit_message:
Introduce states.internal to map service state back

Introduce states.internal() helper function  to map service state back
to astara internal state.

Change-Id: I13f58e37cf5269b336edebd21a1b3e992c005778

commit_message:
Make management service port configurable

Management service port is configurable in Astara project, it should also
be configurable in appliance.
Make management service port configurable instead of hard code it to 5000.

Change-Id: I5829ad8c8e91f7c7588981a621497f7087219bfa

messages: [{'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-01-22 03:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-24 17:56:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nAstara repo is retired.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 03:20:29.000000000', 'message': 'Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: I294af51e026b74a5f75bb0968d4383c10b33c4fc
'}]
commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: I294af51e026b74a5f75bb0968d4383c10b33c4fc

commit_message:
Use tempest instead of Tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been deprecated since a year. All
the interfaces available in tempest-lib are now available
in tempest/lib.

Change-Id: Ic19cbd0452b0551f9efcf10b758b817dde9e7a74

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of the
_LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to avoid
confusion with new contributions. See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I5e703f786f6cdf85f2c269e137b9eb671474261d

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-12-08 17:27:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for neutron database field name

A field in the database changed from tenant_id to project_id,
this is a fix to correct that in astara.

Change-Id: I06da92561187e7e4682005e1e15339d1d7ab1e08
Closes-bug: 1642057
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for neutron database field name

A field in the database changed from tenant_id to project_id,
this is a fix to correct that in astara.

Change-Id: I06da92561187e7e4682005e1e15339d1d7ab1e08
Closes-bug: 1642057

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ifbba36f4974efcf891c7f5938acfeef75bb05dd2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

In the token model, the trust roles are not cached. This behavior
impacts services that are using trusts heavily like heat or magnum.
It introduces new cache data to improve the performance on token
validation requests on trusts.

commit_message:
Add caching on trust role validation to improve performance

In the token model, the trust roles are not cached. This behavior
impacts services that are using trusts heavily like heat or magnum.
It introduces new cache data to improve the performance on token
validation requests on trusts.

Change-Id: I974907b427c34fd5db3228b6139d93bbcdc38df5
Closes-Bug: #1796887
(cherry picked from commit d465a58f02f134086d6322c5b858c056a3aea025)

commit_message:
Fix up compute rpcapi version for pike release

This was wrongly set to 4.18 when pike only supports 4.17

Change-Id: Ic16f30a15fe072eb0619e64575897ed69b9eb947
Closes-Bug: #1799113
(cherry picked from commit 10d64b2c62c54f243e6fb05bc9c7b027d433aae1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-24 10:45:50.000000000', 'message': "Do not use master branch for role tests

OpenStack services shas are overriden for role tests. They
are referring to a variable, test_branch, to determine which
branch to run. By default it uses TESTING_BRANCH environment
variable as the source of truth for its value.
However, TESTING_BRANCH is unset in tox.ini. The resulting
test_branch's value is master.

This is a problem, as stable/rocky role tests should run
stable/rocky version of openstack services.

This fixes it by making sure the fallback of the env lookup
is stable/rocky, not master.

Change-Id: Ifedfbb803fe3e3ccce8c13389a2f4dd23757bd6e
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use master branch for role tests

OpenStack services shas are overriden for role tests. They
are referring to a variable, test_branch, to determine which
branch to run. By default it uses TESTING_BRANCH environment
variable as the source of truth for its value.
However, TESTING_BRANCH is unset in tox.ini. The resulting
test_branch's value is master.

This is a problem, as stable/rocky role tests should run
stable/rocky version of openstack services.

This fixes it by making sure the fallback of the env lookup
is stable/rocky, not master.

Change-Id: Ifedfbb803fe3e3ccce8c13389a2f4dd23757bd6e

commit_message:
Re-proposes multiple vGPU types in libvirt

This spec is for telling libvirt how to manage multiple vGPU types.
The only modification to the approved spec in Rocky is the
upgrade section that mentions the reshape.

Change-Id: Ib82f32cb448d4e003933f4791a0bed0cbf3b526d
Previously-approved: Rocky

commit_message:
Set min and max length for resource_name

This patch addresses the problem of HTTP 500 on
create and set of limit with lengthy resource_name.
It sets the minLength and maxLength in schema for
resource_name and if the string length of resource_
name exceeds the defined schema it will raise 404.
Includes test case too.

Change-Id: If408e81edec81c649c42bd4907156fbcdbc967ee
Closes-Bug: #1798495

commit_message:
sriov-agent: Report resource info in heartbeat

Example config for sriov-agent:

sriov_agent.ini:
[sriov_nic]
physical_device_mappings = physnet0:ens5,physnet0:ens6
resource_provider_bandwidths = ens5:100000:100000,ens6:100000:100000

Agent configurations now includes 'resource_provider_bandwidths' and
'resource_provider_inventory_defaults'.

Change-Id: I1af798d404ed94cd30da3f92734bea911bbc3ac7
Co-Authored-By: Lajos Katona <lajos.katona@ericsson.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/577220
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

subject: MNAIO: Implement branch var for pinning Ansible & Plugins
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-24 09:39:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 290, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:14:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7414, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:36:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-24 09:39:22.000000000', 'message': "MNAIO: Implement branch var for pinning Ansible & Plugins

Due to [1] the task 'Create data cinder-volumes group' is currently
failing when run on a restored image due to the idempotence failure.

In this patch we enable pinning the requirements file and plugins
repo to a different OSA branch, and set it to stable/rocky which is
currently pinned to Ansible 2.5.10 and does not exhibit this issue.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/47301

Change-Id: Id0f98f3ea0f53173dae800d45f1a4554c8a0c38a
"}]
commit_message:
MNAIO: Implement branch var for pinning Ansible & Plugins

Due to [1] the task 'Create data cinder-volumes group' is currently
failing when run on a restored image due to the idempotence failure.

In this patch we enable pinning the requirements file and plugins
repo to a different OSA branch, and set it to stable/rocky which is
currently pinned to Ansible 2.5.10 and does not exhibit this issue.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/47301

Change-Id: Id0f98f3ea0f53173dae800d45f1a4554c8a0c38a

subject: Don't use pypi releases for ceilomter
messages:
[{'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Without this, ceilometer-powervm stable/rocky commits will gate on the version of ceilometer flagged in requirements.txt (currently >=11.0.0), released and available on pypi. With this, we will instead gate using ceilometer stable/rocky, which could have as-yet-unreleased changes that we want to test with.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-23 15:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Manual cherry pick diff is the py36 job which is in master but not stable.'}, {'account_id': 13557, 'date': '2018-10-23 15:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16069, 'date': '2018-10-24 05:22:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-10-24 05:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:25:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 14:47:18.000000000', 'message': "Don't use pypi releases for ceilomter

Use the newly created project-templates to gate on the corresponding
ceilometer branch.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/609901
Change-Id: Iab267fc2b62f9519af50263bb90fb4124214c8e8
(cherry picked from commit 4a9a647558e1eec16eaebfd0fc7282eeab3669ab)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use pypi releases for ceilomter

Use the newly created project-templates to gate on the corresponding
ceilometer branch.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/609901
Change-Id: Iab267fc2b62f9519af50263bb90fb4124214c8e8
(cherry picked from commit 4a9a647558e1eec16eaebfd0fc7282eeab3669ab)

commit_message:
Refactor periodic "tips" jobs

Two changes:
1 - declare the abstract base tips jobs 'abstract'
2 - add a branch matcher to where the periodic tips jobs
    are invoked in the project definition so that they only
    apply to the master branch

Change-Id: Ic54255a2035d747c15b16faaf470a8949939fe4f

fix provides epoch on singlespec based packages

without this epoch is never part of provides which fails on comparision
with 'old' epoch based packages

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-02-22 12:14:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-02-22 12:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

WIP. Need to add tests.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-02-22 12:32:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

nice to see this started.
you are probably have noticed that currently we hard code the use of the shell implementation. this is due to a file handle leak in pyroute2. its good to keep both versions updated with new feautres but hopefully the shell implementation will be deleted in rocky.

with that in mind we will need unit test for both drivers but if you choose to add fuctional tests it should be driver independet so that they dont need to be rewitten when we default to pyroute2 and delete the shell driver.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-09-26 14:29:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> nice to see this started.
 > you are probably have noticed that currently we hard code the use
 > of the shell implementation. this is due to a file handle leak in
 > pyroute2. its good to keep both versions updated with new feautres
 > but hopefully the shell implementation will be deleted in rocky.
 > 
 > with that in mind we will need unit test for both drivers but if
 > you choose to add fuctional tests it should be driver independet so
 > that they dont need to be rewitten when we default to pyroute2 and
 > delete the shell driver.

Given that ralonsoh is working on dropping the shell version in [1], this should probably be rebased on top of that. Do you plan to continue working on this, Carlos? If so, anything we can do to help?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/605422'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-09-28 19:50:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My focus of work slightly changed soon after I submitted last patch set. All: feel free to take this over:-)'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-09-28 20:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-09-28 20:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Rebased on top of https://review.openstack.org/605422'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-01 11:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

can you show where this will be used in the linux bridge or ovs plugins?

the internal ip tables libs cannot be used by external plugins.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-01 11:29:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:19:58.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Sorry folks, I don't have the cycles to work on this anymore hence I'm abandoning it. Anyone interested in taking on this effort, please feel free to!"}]

commit_message:
Introduce network namespace aware plugging

Interfaces of network namespace supported VIF types can be placed in
network namespaces other than the root network namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1666931

Change-Id: I1abd7c65b750c960682e56a1ab9f017ae829e534

commit_message:
Fix up userdata argument to rebuild.

This was using the name of the file as user data as opposed
to the content of the file.

Closes-bug: #1794419

commit_message:
migration: workaround ovs-vswitchd bug during migration

Because of [1], when a controller is disconnected and you add a new
port to an Open vSwitch bridge ovs-vswitchd crashes.

There's a patch upstream, but this will allow us to continue
without

Closes-Bug: #1798377

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1640045

(cherry-picked from d658e44bb2df3a485325af78345c0e418676d519)

Change-Id: Id47086d50167fd417d0be67b720f63be62e3ff35

commit_message:
Add rbac policies client

This patch creates the network v2.0 rbac_policies client.
This client has the folowing api calls
- rbac-create
- rbac-delete
- rbac-list
- rbac-show
- rbac-update
This patch also includes tests for the new rbac policies client.

Change-Id: I3ab8a7436987e3a9deb50abee06c0b04d31b95f4

'}, {'created': '2018-10-18 16:21:17.000000000', 'message': "Add change_physical_disk_state function to client

Build a list of controllers which had disks converted
to or from RAID/JBOD and inidicate if a reboot is required.

The following steps allow the caller to retrieve a list of
controllers that have disks comverted to the specified
RAID status:
- Examine all disks in the system and filter out any that
are not attached to a RAID/BOSS controller.
- Inspect the controllers' disks to see if there are
disks that need to be converted. If a disk is already in
the desired status the disk is ignored, otherwise
it is converted. This function also handles failed or
unknown disk status appropriately and will raise exception(s)
where needed.
- Finally a dict is returned containing a list of controller
IDs for controllers whom had any of their disks converted,
and whether a reboot is required.

Typically the caller would then create a config job for the
list of controllers returned to finalize the RAID
configuration and reboot the node if necessary.

Change-Id: I5229f7699c9ca1d5b72a54b4ddcea6313b440836
Co-Authored-By: Christopher Dearborn <Christopher.Dearborn@dell.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-10-19 22:44:20.000000000', 'message': "Add change_physical_disk_state function to client

"}]
commit_message:
Add change_physical_disk_state function to client

Build a list of controllers which had disks converted
to or from RAID/JBOD and inidicate if a reboot is required.

The following steps allow the caller to retrieve a list of
controllers that have disks comverted to the specified
RAID status:
- Examine all disks in the system and filter out any that
are not attached to a RAID/BOSS controller.
- Inspect the controllers' disks to see if there are
disks that need to be converted. If a disk is already in
the desired status the disk is ignored, otherwise
it is converted. This function also handles failed or
unknown disk status appropriately and will raise exception(s)
where needed.
- Finally a dict is returned containing a list of controller
IDs for controllers whom had any of their disks converted,
and whether a reboot is required.

Typically the caller would then create a config job for the
list of controllers returned to finalize the RAID
configuration and reboot the node if necessary.

Change-Id: I5229f7699c9ca1d5b72a54b4ddcea6313b440836
Co-Authored-By: Christopher Dearborn <Christopher.Dearborn@dell.com>

- gate-tempest-dsvm-full-sheepdog-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/54/455454/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-full-sheepdog-ubuntu-xenial-nv/b27ee0f/ : FAILURE in 56m 06s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-07-10 12:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I have followed all steps mentioned on the bug after applying this patch and still it is not updating the capabilities.

I need to check in more what exactly the problem is.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-07-13 16:26:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Me, I can't reproduce the original bug.  I get a different error when I try to create the image with the root:root ownership:

 503 Service Unavailable: Insufficient permissions on image storage media: Permission to write image storage media denied. (HTTP 503)

But when I flip the ownership back, it works right away."}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2017-07-19 16:02:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Abhishek: indeed. The update happens every N minutes, so it may not work immediatly. If you wait for a bit, though, you'll definitely see that it works. In the tests, I manually trigger update_capabilities, so that the change is effective immediately.

@Eric: well, that is weird. Did you do everything as written in the bug report?"}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2017-10-26 14:53:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I like this approach/patch overall but my -1 is due lack of documentation on how this works and how it should work for the ops.

I think that patch can be in glance, unless you have it wip. please link it here or add some release note to this patch. I'd prefer to add both, release note for this store patch but for ops we need something in glance that will have permanent place for new/old/changing deployemnts."}, {'account_id': 26734, 'date': '2017-10-27 21:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Will second the docs/release notes but this looks good from the code perspective and should function as expected.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-24 13:55:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Just adding this so I can find it more easily next time.  Here's our discussion of this patch at the weekly glance meeting:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/glance/2017/glance.2017-11-02-14.01.log.html#l-44

The short version is instead of going this route, we advise people to use systemd to make sure the mount is ready before glance starts.  Here's one way to do that: 
https://serverfault.com/questions/682553/systemd-start-a-unit-after-another-unit-really-starts"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-24 13:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Went with a different approach: see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561111/'}]

commit_message:
Implement update_capabilities for the filesystem store

Glance will be able to add/remove the WRITE_ACCESS capability whenever changes
to the file system are made.

Change-Id: I00a55d76d938afa4215767942f5d0cae9acea41b
Closes-Bug: #1681485

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-05 07:50:42.000000000', 'message': "Stop console at tearing down without unsetting console_enabled

A node's console_enabled is reset to False at tearing down not to
expose the console to an instance user. This requires an operator to
set The console_enabled to True when another instance is created on the
node.

This patch stops a console at tearing down a node with keeping
console_enabled True. Then, the console is started at deployment.

Change-Id: I42c209af80465b12720b41fd96ae9477091eaf24
Story: #2003972
Task: #26914
"}]
commit_message:
Stop console at tearing down without unsetting console_enabled

A node's console_enabled is reset to False at tearing down not to
expose the console to an instance user. This requires an operator to
set The console_enabled to True when another instance is created on the
node.

This patch stops a console at tearing down a node with keeping
console_enabled True. Then, the console is started at deployment.

Change-Id: I42c209af80465b12720b41fd96ae9477091eaf24
Story: #2003972
Task: #26914

commit_message:
nova: add support for a dedicated migration network

Two new parameters (migration_interface, migration_interface_address) to make
the use of a dedicated migration network possible.

Change-Id: I723c9bea9cf1881e02ba39d5318c090960c22c47

subject: [SPEC] Add basic quotas
messages:
[{'account_id': 23382, 'date': '2017-07-27 09:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-27 09:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-glance-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/77/487777/1/check/gate-glance-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/ccdef76//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 32s
- gate-glance-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/77/487777/1/check/gate-glance-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/5de05be/ : SUCCESS in 1m 47s'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-07-31 21:15:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Some points to address inline.

This would be a good discussion topic at the PTG; you may want to apply for a travel grant if you don't have travel support.  Details are at the bottom of this etherpad: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/glance-queens-ptg-planning"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-09-29 03:10:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just a reminder that the spec freeze for Queens is 23:59 UTC on Friday 6 October.  This must be merged before that time in order to be considered for Queens.'}, {'account_id': 2033, 'date': '2017-10-02 16:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm really interested in having basic quotas in glance.
Private clouds rely in quotas to provide the resources that projects need. Not having quotas means that any user can exhaust the storage resources available.
Glance provides the config options "image_size_cap" and "user_storage_quota" but these are global and because we can have tenants that really need large images/lots of storage... all users have the same big caps.

Having initially a "user_storage_quota" per tenant would solve most of the issues.
And then would be great to iterate with all the limits work that is still in design phase.'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2017-10-05 14:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

this is a good start, we do need quite a bit of work on this. I will link an older spec that has good amount of detail, feel free to be inspired from it as needed.'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2017-10-05 14:57:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

here's the older quota link: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/275674/"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-10-06 12:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note: we agreed at the weekly Glance meeting that this spec will not be accepted into Queens.'}, {'account_id': 26734, 'date': '2017-10-25 12:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Few comments, good idea to work on would like to see this one refined and added to the specs for the next version.'}, {'account_id': 2033, 'date': '2018-02-23 16:53:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Added this spec as a reference for the PTG Dublin quotas discussion.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-24 13:12:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No activity in 8 months.  Feel free to re-propose if you are interested in pursuing this topic.'}]

subject: New image status "deleting"
messages:
[{'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-15 10:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-15 10:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/s to new-image-status-deleteing'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-15 10:46:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-15 10:47:03.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from topic/new-image-status-deleteing to new-image-status-deleteing'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-02-15 12:47:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

(5 comments)

Based on the problem description the main issues this proposal is to be solving has been solved already. While there is good thought behind this proposal, I do fail to see the benefit that would justify the cost.

More details inline.'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-19 10:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dear Erno,
          Thanks for reviewing this. Below were my findings. This is the function which gets invoked to delete the image in image v2 api.
    def remove(self, image):
        try:
>>>>>>>>>>> self.db_api.image_update(self.context, image.image_id,
                                     {'status': image.status},
                                     purge_props=True)
        except (exception.ImageNotFound, exception.Forbidden):
            msg = _("No image found with ID %s") % image.image_id
            raise exception.ImageNotFound(msg)
        # NOTE(markwash): don't update tags?
>>>>>>> new_values = self.db_api.image_destroy(self.context, image.image_id)
        image.updated_at = new_values['updated_at']

In above, we set the image status in db as "deleted" and then we do the real deletion from backend and the rest of the metadata. 
So, here if, the image deletion fails at backend then the image state will be deleted but in the backend data is not deleted.
Even though if, one thinks to interchange above actions, image deletion at backend first and then image status update. Then if, image status update in db fails, image is in in-consistent state.

Hence, I feel there is a strong need to have an intermediate state = "deleting" and error state = "error" to keep the image in consistent state across operations. Just like other components of openstack.

Thanks,
Prateek'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-19 11:11:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-19 11:12:45.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/s to new-image-status-deleteing'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-19 11:21:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-02-19 14:56:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Dear Erno,
 > Thanks for reviewing this. Below were my findings. This is the
 > function which gets invoked to delete the image in image v2 api.
 > def remove(self, image):
 > try:
 > >>>>>>>>>>> self.db_api.image_update(self.context, image.image_id,
 > {'status': image.status},
 > purge_props=True)
 > except (exception.ImageNotFound, exception.Forbidden):
 > msg = _("No image found with ID %s") % image.image_id
 > raise exception.ImageNotFound(msg)
 > # NOTE(markwash): don't update tags?
 > >>>>>>> new_values = self.db_api.image_destroy(self.context,
 > image.image_id)
 > image.updated_at = new_values['updated_at']
 > 
 > In above, we set the image status in db as "deleted" and then we do
 > the real deletion from backend and the rest of the metadata.
 > So, here if, the image deletion fails at backend then the image
 > state will be deleted but in the backend data is not deleted.
 > Even though if, one thinks to interchange above actions, image
 > deletion at backend first and then image status update. Then if,
 > image status update in db fails, image is in in-consistent state.
 > 
 > Hence, I feel there is a strong need to have an intermediate state
 > = "deleting" and error state = "error" to keep the image in
 > consistent state across operations. Just like other components of
 > openstack.

Thanks Prateek,

The problem with your logic is that we will end up endless loops of what ifs and new states. As in your example of the db action failing, if we have db issues, we cannot set the error status, should we then try to se the status to error_while_error? You can see where this logic fails quite quickly. Same time if the glance-api node does drop to for example network isolation in middle of all this action we might end up with image in deleting state that might or might not have data still in backend and never goes to error state. Adding layers of different states that depends on the same resources are not helpful, does not resolve the possible inconsistencies during faults and definitely does not make anyone's life any better trying to debug what is going on as these states are not something we expect to see in daily operation. We do extensive logging to make the debugging efforts possible and if you think there is something that should be added to identify where the fault occurred, please lets work out and make sure such is logged.

- jokke
 > 
 > Thanks,
 > Prateek'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-19 16:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Dear Jokke,
          Thanks for discussing on this extensively.. :) its encouraging to contribute to the community. Yes such status loops never end :). I was looking at it as the other components nova and cinder do it today.

Thanks,
Prateek'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-19 17:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Dear Jokke,
           On a different note, can there be a new API to validate the image status and backend data. Something like imageDbValidate, which will do the checks for image integrity.
Just felt like discussing ideas here... 

Thanks,
Prateek'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-24 13:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No activity in 8 months.'}]

commit_message:
New image status "deleting"

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/new-image-status-deleting
Glance image delete should always leave the image in consistent state ir-respective of failure
during delete operation.

Change-Id: Ie5674f86ba095aecc6d0eec9631b44a2339a138f

[{'created': '2018-08-29 14:43:42.000000000', 'message': 'Log the operation when updating generation in ProviderTree

Today when a provider generation is updated we get a mostly
unhelpful message in the logs like:

  Updating resource provider bc0f4c8e-96e2-4e68-a06e-f7e0ac9aac6b
  generation from 0 to 1

What we really want to know with that is in what context did the
generation change, i.e. did inventory or traits change?

This adds the actual operation to the log message when generation
changes.

commit_message:
Log the operation when updating generation in ProviderTree

Today when a provider generation is updated we get a mostly
unhelpful message in the logs like:

  Updating resource provider bc0f4c8e-96e2-4e68-a06e-f7e0ac9aac6b
  generation from 0 to 1

What we really want to know with that is in what context did the
generation change, i.e. did inventory or traits change?

This adds the actual operation to the log message when generation
changes.

Change-Id: I9b61f1dfb8db06e02ff79e19c055c673094a4ed2
Related-Bug: #1789654

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 08:49:22.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id98703e0a159949afc11304405dc3052dac08c35
'}, {'created': '2018-10-24 12:23:13.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id98703e0a159949afc11304405dc3052dac08c35

commit_message:
Add framework for karbor-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of karbor-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: I8b75d516725c7cdf169d558b1c4b6f92a695ab2e
Story: 2003657
Task: 26134

commit_message:
Add manila-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for manila-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: Id809535d0a01617916a8e29f151ca4e61f738fad
Story: 2003657
Task: 26139

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:49:51.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If51ceaf9c96a886b17d3bc793176c839e06d0b72
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If51ceaf9c96a886b17d3bc793176c839e06d0b72
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'account_id': 26556, 'date': '2017-08-14 23:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-08-14 23:55:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-15 00:51:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add support of ceph as glance backend.

The init-runonce can not support when using ceph as glance backend,because
ceph can not support qcow2,need convert.

Change-Id: I04fc9e7d3cc0bbf248951684659a708d3a513d7f
Closes:init_ceph

commit_message:
Add posibilities to set default timeouts

Default timeouts for backend member and frontend
client can be set now via config file.
Timeouts exposed in config in section haproxy_amphora:
 * timeout_client_data
 * timeout_member_connect
 * timeout_member_data
 * timeout_tcp_inspect

Change-Id: I6e1be42c5c15c4171b012734e4c2a1fded51dbc7
Partial-Bug: 1797130
Story: 2004042
Task: 27046

commit_message:
Restore OpenSUSE voting jobs

In https://review.openstack.org/609329 we had to disable
voting for the OpenSUSE jobs due to mirror issues. This
patch restores the jobs to voting again.

Change-Id: If2091627b3518d1e16127ff9706ad28bc3ce1502
(cherry picked from commit d9f210952a90417b4a2efe54e0511414d0084095)

commit_message:
Move to GreenThreadPoolExecutor

python3.7 and eventlet cause the `future.ThreadPoolExecutor` to hang
indefinitely. Moving to `futurist.GreenThreadPoolExecutor` allows the
`designate-worker` process to use native eventlet greenthreads, which bypasses
the hanging issue.

Closes-Bug: #1782647

Related-Bug: https://bugs.python.org/issue34173
Related-Bug: eventlet/eventlet#508

Change-Id: I36c79ca72635d81cfcc8d3cc87b1bc5e0657d9e8
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

But if the one discussed inline is the only one we have, I say we shouldn't move forward with this. Because that use case is brittle and will soon be bogus."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-02 20:00:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Great idea. Have a suggestion for a potentially less impactful change to the API (just allow resources=$RC_NAME without the ":$AMOUNT" specifier).'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-23 13:54:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

If we write up "capacity planning dashboard" as a use case, I would support this change. However, since nobody's asking for it, and we're pretty overextended with stuff that *is* in demand, we shouldn't do it now. Do we have a process for approving a spec but not for Stein? Create a specs/future/approved/ directory?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-23 20:17:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Or to put it another way: I can't be bothered to clean it up right now."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 12:12:30.000000000', 'message': "List resource providers having inventory

This is a speculative spec at this point, writing it down to not
forget it. If people think it represents a need we can flesh it
out.

There's currently no way, over the placement API, to filter a list
of resource providers by them having a set of resource classes of
inventory. Using the ``resources`` parameter it is possible to get a
list of providers that have capacity in those classes, but any
provider which has the class but is at capacity will not be listed.
This is potentially problematic for inspecting the the resource
provider environment.

This proposes GET /resource_providers?having=VCPU as possible way
address this.

blueprint bp/list-rps-having

Change-Id: I0b9ca4b647c6ac16dd7f1b0fdfde498c4ae7753c
"}, {'created': '2018-09-05 13:46:24.000000000', 'message': "List resource providers having inventory

This is a speculative spec at this point, writing it down to not
forget it. If people think it represents a need we can flesh it
out.

There's currently no way, over the placement API, to filter a list
of resource providers by them having a set of resource classes of
inventory. Using the ``resources`` parameter it is possible to get a
list of providers that have capacity in those classes, but any
provider which has the class but is at capacity will not be listed.
This is potentially problematic for inspecting the the resource
provider environment.

commit_message:
List resource providers having inventory

This is a speculative spec at this point, writing it down to not
forget it. If people think it represents a need we can flesh it
out.

There's currently no way, over the placement API, to filter a list
of resource providers by them having a set of resource classes of
inventory. Using the ``resources`` parameter it is possible to get a
list of providers that have capacity in those classes, but any
provider which has the class but is at capacity will not be listed.
This is potentially problematic for inspecting the the resource
provider environment.

This proposes GET /resource_providers?having=VCPU as possible way
address this.

blueprint list-rps-having

Change-Id: I0b9ca4b647c6ac16dd7f1b0fdfde498c4ae7753c

commit_message:
Fix unexpected behavior in _clone_image_volume

Current, if we upload a snapshot-volume to image, then create
a new volume from this image, this new volume is created from
original snapshot rather than snapshot-volume.

That means if we already make some data change on a
snapshot-volume, then we export this snapshot-volume to image,
this image will lose all change data.

This patch try to fix this, we skip the "snapshot_id" and
"source_volid" when we create tmp image volume.

Closes-bug: 1795098

Change-Id: Icf0dadc1ce4d008ff437ca5dcde1817d2e560e44

'}, {'created': '2018-10-23 05:04:49.000000000', 'message': 'Improve join by removing periodic jobs

* This patch removes the approach to do DB polling in order to
  determine if a "join" task is ready to run. Instead of running
  a periodic scheduled job, each task completion now runs the
  algorithm that finds all potentially affected join tasks
  and schedules just one job (instead of a periodic job) to check
  their readiness.
  This solves a problem of system cascaded overloading in case of
  having many very large joins (when a workflow has many joins with
  many  dependencies each). Previously, in such case Mistral created
  too many periodic jobs that just didn't let the workflow progress
  well, i.e. most CPU was used by scheduler to run those periodic
  jobs that very rarely switched "join" tasks to the RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I5ebc44c7a3f95c868d653689dc5cea689c788cd0

commit_message:
Improve join by removing periodic jobs

* This patch removes the approach with DB polling needed to
  determine if a "join" task is ready to run. Instead of running
  a periodic scheduled job, each task completion now runs the
  algorithm that finds all potentially affected join tasks
  and schedules just one job (instead of a periodic job) to check
  their readiness.
  This solves a problem of system cascaded overloading in case of
  having many very large joins (when a workflow has many joins with
  many  dependencies each). Previously, in such case Mistral created
  too many periodic jobs that just didn't let the workflow progress
  well, i.e. most CPU was used by scheduler to run those periodic
  jobs that very rarely switched "join" tasks to the RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I5ebc44c7a3f95c868d653689dc5cea689c788cd0
Closes-Bug: #1799356

commit_message:
Add nova::vendordata to nova compute

A recent change making nova-metadata-api work with wsgi
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582621/ moved the vendordata plugin
parameters to the nova::metadata manifest.
In practice the parameters are also used in compute drivers (in the ironic
driver, for instance).

Change-Id: If9a505692135945adaabc37360a8857b6c907096
Related-Bug: 1799352
Depends-On: Ic3654c79d8cf275f0c58d57a4b66e2598450a7ed

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-10-24 06:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-24 09:45:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 249f327bdbd50c516d2ff18fb78ae406cd1c3620'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 10:49:32.000000000', 'message': 'test-log-collect: Disable repositories when collecting installed on SUSE

zypper performs some network operations when collecting the list of
installed packages which slow down the overall process. We already have
the per host list of repositories so we can do some maths to figure out
where each package is coming from.

As we see below, disabling the repositories saves us ~9s.
~$ time zypper --quiet pa -i
real    0m10.607s
user    0m9.024s
sys     0m0.193s

~$ time zypper --disable-repositories pa -i
real    0m1.043s
user    0m0.833s
sys     0m0.136s

On a deployment with multiple containers, the 9s difference causes a lot
of overhead and jobs are timing out from time to time. As such, lets
just disable the repositories when collecting the list of the installed
packages.

Change-Id: I3e48dad0e213f6e24a2ceb4033b1a53873b6e298
'}, {'created': '2018-10-23 10:52:36.000000000', 'message': 'test-log-collect: Disable repositories when collecting installed pkgs on SUSE

zypper performs some network operations when collecting the list of
installed packages which slow down the overall process. We already have
the per host list of repositories so we can do some maths to figure out
where each package is coming from.

As we see below, disabling the repositories saves us ~9s.
~$ time zypper --quiet pa -i
real    0m10.607s
user    0m9.024s
sys     0m0.193s

~$ time zypper --disable-repositories pa -i
real    0m1.043s
user    0m0.833s
sys     0m0.136s

On a deployment with multiple containers, the 9s difference causes a lot
of overhead and jobs are timing out from time to time. As such, lets
just disable the repositories when collecting the list of the installed
packages.

Change-Id: I3e48dad0e213f6e24a2ceb4033b1a53873b6e298
'}]
commit_message:
test-log-collect: Disable repositories when collecting installed pkgs on SUSE

zypper performs some network operations when collecting the list of
installed packages which slow down the overall process. We already have
the per host list of repositories so we can do some maths to figure out
where each package is coming from.

As we see below, disabling the repositories saves us ~9s.
~$ time zypper --quiet pa -i
real    0m10.607s
user    0m9.024s
sys     0m0.193s

~$ time zypper --disable-repositories pa -i
real    0m1.043s
user    0m0.833s
sys     0m0.136s

On a deployment with multiple containers, the 9s difference causes a lot
of overhead and jobs are timing out from time to time. As such, lets
just disable the repositories when collecting the list of the installed
packages.

Change-Id: I3e48dad0e213f6e24a2ceb4033b1a53873b6e298

commit_message:
Mark build task changed only when wheels are built

Only set the 'Build wheels for the packages to be installed into the
venv' task to changed when new wheels are built or saved.

Change-Id: Iec1818c54f4a40791cbb69d9cc726960c905c069

[{'created': '2018-09-25 14:20:05.000000000', 'message': 'DNM & WIP: Enable network policy enforcement

This patch set updates the gate to by default uses networkpolicy
for all components in OpenStack-Helm and enforces them rather than
isolating network policy testing to just one zuul job in [0].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598189/

commit_message:
Enable network policy enforcement

This patch set updates the gate to by default uses network policy
for all components and enforces them in Openstack-helm.

Change-Id: I70c90b5808075797f02670f21481a4f968205325
Depends-On: I78e87ef3276e948ae4dd2eb462b4b8012251c8c8
Co-Authored-By: Mike Pham <tp6510@att.com>
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Set options for KV backends

Ensure KV backend is created as a v2 backend by using
explicit provision of options when enabling the secret
backend.

Change-Id: Ief0a26c8a1adb9f6be39fa497222f809994c11d0

commit_message:
rabbitmq_upgrade_check: Do not complain for upgrades on distro packages

Distributions normally provide one version of rabbitmq. Comparing this
version against the one provided by packagecloud makes little sense
unless the user explicitly requested to install the package from an
external source. As such, we should not complain when distribution
packages are used.

Change-Id: If56873908776ce7a6908f6c4d4aef096d084859f
(cherry picked from commit 75ba65c1008106a90cffe6d080fe02459f6c2ae4)

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

commit_message:
Add default for openrc_os_domain_name and update example

There is currently no default value for openrc_os_domain_name,
so we add one, and we update the example to remove the unnecessary
overrides.

Change-Id: Ic18b07d9347260faf828a55112f0b38e86e617f5
(cherry picked from commit 838100cf265b19f5562e12a57cfefc1746a33837)

Remove paste-ini

Remove the paste-ini for Stein release. It has not been used since
Rocky and was maintained for simplicity of deployment projects.

commit_message:
Remove pre-flask legacy code

This removes common.controller, common.extension, common.router, and
common.wsgi. Relevant code from common.wsgi (used by AuthContext) was
moved into keystone.server.flask.request_processing.middleware.auth_context.

keystone.api.discovery now uses keystone.flask.base_url

test_middleware and test_exception were modified to reflect the changes
to the remaining code from keystone.common.wsgi

keystone.common.authorization only holds a couple constants for auth
work now.

Routes is removed from requirements.txt

Release-Note for migration to flask added.

Change-Id: I81563b6a49c8f12ecade058a9483f3b6f070dc72
Closes-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Refactor app response for api request '/api/keystone/svc-catalog'

Add filtration for service catalog. Now all endpoints that are not
public will not be seen.

Change-Id: I6db214f849d13c4c71e176f00113e889ff2d2997
Closes-Bug: #1798832

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- puppet-openstack-integration-5-scenario001-tempest-centos-7-luminous: unrecognized error
- puppet-openstack-integration-5-scenario002-tempest-centos-7: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1763070
- puppet-openstack-integration-5-scenario002-tempest-ubuntu-bionic: unrecognized error
- tripleo-puppet-ci-centos-7-standalone: unrecognized error

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/

commit_message:
Add puppet-cinder-tripleo-standalone job

* It overrrides the tripleo-standalone featureset override to run
  cinder specific tempest tests.

* It will help to detect the puppet-cinder tempest specific issues early
  in gates.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610600/

Change-Id: I5c2073db48192f45b36c4555408fb0cdff72c51d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-12 16:26:36.000000000', 'message': 'V2 driver is needed to work with ODL 9.0

The new version of ODL (released 28th of August) requires the version 2
of the SFC driver in order for SFC to work

Change-Id: Idc50e27b84cc6287765dea1cb6b69dd53e4960d2
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-09-24 07:35:52.000000000', 'message': 'V2 driver is needed to work with ODL 9.0

commit_message:
V2 driver is needed to work with ODL 9.0

The new version of ODL (released 28th of August) requires the version 2
of the SFC driver in order for SFC to work

Change-Id: Idc50e27b84cc6287765dea1cb6b69dd53e4960d2
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

subject: Create virtualenv without downloading
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-23 09:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-23 09:01:39.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to isolated-pip-options-stable/rocky'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-23 09:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-23 09:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-23 09:24:49.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from isolated-pip-options-stable/rocky to isolated-virtualenv-create'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-10-23 09:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2\n\ntested locally to resolve issues when rebuilding venvs'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-10-24 07:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 09:01:11.000000000', 'message': 'Isolate repo wheel builds from pip.conf

The repo wheel builds need to be isolated from pip.conf
to ensure that new wheels can be built whenever doing an
upgrade.

This backport includes the added change to the venv build
options. The venv build process has been removed from Stein
so the added change does not apply.

Change-Id: Iba22f5a11af858b52f006494b30002d34e5aa4f6
(cherry picked from commit ac816e20c33419163dfe78da004011e1eb78605d)
'}, {'created': '2018-10-23 09:23:44.000000000', 'message': 'Create virtualenv without downloading

When creating the virtualenv, we would rather just
use the pip/setuptools packages already available on
the host, then upgrade them later. This helps keeps
the builds isolated to the versions we want, and
reduces outgoing requests which is important for
isolated builds.

Change-Id: Iba22f5a11af858b52f006494b30002d34e5aa4f6
'}]
commit_message:
Create virtualenv without downloading

When creating the virtualenv, we would rather just
use the pip/setuptools packages already available on
the host, then upgrade them later. This helps keeps
the builds isolated to the versions we want, and
reduces outgoing requests which is important for
isolated builds.

Change-Id: Iba22f5a11af858b52f006494b30002d34e5aa4f6

commit_message:
Remove the redundant attributes

DeleteInstance action inherits from tables.DeleteAction,
the parent class has the 'name', 'classes' and 'icon' attributes,
So remove the unused attributes.

Change-Id: I5ef01ce68edcd7e78ac95747cf5fd8d8f8c96c81

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

In this role's case there are no containers, so I've just removed
the group_var so that the test setup is uniform with other roles
which do use containers.

Change-Id: I5a5063c93eecc7981f6413f37871a97eb0197c85

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

In this role's case there are no containers, so I've just removed
the group_var so that the test setup is uniform with other roles
which do use containers.

Change-Id: Ifde552c38d219ede46f3c4c8091e38048205d02f

There are errors in executing session-add-job in v2 interface such as: freezer session-add-job --session-id 52878644aab14446a2f3c97b13c48190 --job-id 3c421a3c42d447e2ab514c0d21cb595f [*] Error 500: 500 Internal Server Error

Internal Server Error

The server encountered an internal error or misconfiguration and was unable to complete your request.

Change-Id: I36bbbc817bdbb86b9590504ec3d8323be928e9bd

The last release is 1.6.0'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-10-24 06:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Got it. But why did the release team propose 2.0.0 in the other patch?'}, {'account_id': 21069, 'date': '2018-10-24 06:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In the release team propose 2.0.0 patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/612850/ ,

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-17 14:09:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix formatting non-templated cell URLs with no config

If transport_url or connection are unset in config, we will fail to format
even non-templated cell mapping URLs due to an overly specific check in the
format routines. This fixes it by always bailing on templating if the config
is unset, and keeping the error message if we were unable to format a
template as a result.

Change-Id: I760580b8e6594be2bee99a5b825a690b07ab9deb
Closes-Bug: #1798158
(cherry picked from commit 133d6b3bcc26bb2e66ef303011280e38add00702)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix formatting non-templated cell URLs with no config

If transport_url or connection are unset in config, we will fail to format
even non-templated cell mapping URLs due to an overly specific check in the
format routines. This fixes it by always bailing on templating if the config
is unset, and keeping the error message if we were unable to format a
template as a result.

Change-Id: I760580b8e6594be2bee99a5b825a690b07ab9deb
Closes-Bug: #1798158
(cherry picked from commit 133d6b3bcc26bb2e66ef303011280e38add00702)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-18 19:15:18.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7cbf62cee124db959b1ac2698b6989c3e59a55ab
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7cbf62cee124db959b1ac2698b6989c3e59a55ab
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

With the default setting, the keepalived that we deploy on the master
node collides with the one that is setup on the undercloud. We simply

virtual_router_id collision.

Change-Id: I92ef081a111f93ddce4ec42400bcb648b7f7def0
(cherry picked from commit 429bc3ca702c4bb68062a1d9e653d528246d0950)
'}]
commit_message:
Use different base virtual_router_id on openshift

With the default setting, the keepalived that we deploy on the master
node collides with the one that is setup on the undercloud. We simply
need to use a different virtual_router_id_base to prevent
virtual_router_id collision.

Change-Id: I92ef081a111f93ddce4ec42400bcb648b7f7def0
(cherry picked from commit 429bc3ca702c4bb68062a1d9e653d528246d0950)

under Python 3.6 as part of the python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I1e860339c2fad9e86c0a2cacf344a6ff94325873

[{'created': '2018-10-19 17:04:30.000000000', 'message': 'PY3 : Replice dict.iteritems() with dict.items()

py3 tests for cyborg are failing due to
dict.iteritems() which has been removed in python 3 [1].
This patch replaces that usage with dict.items,
which also works in python 2.7, as recommended.

[1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/Python3.0#Built-In_Changes

Change-Id: Ic23c0c09b346cb59344828e8189036306072e040
'}]
commit_message:
PY3 : Replice dict.iteritems() with dict.items()

py3 tests for cyborg are failing due to
dict.iteritems() which has been removed in python 3 [1].
This patch replaces that usage with dict.items,
which also works in python 2.7, as recommended.

[1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/Python3.0#Built-In_Changes

Change-Id: Ic23c0c09b346cb59344828e8189036306072e040
